reviews.title: not a 4 star hotel

reviews.text: - incident with the reserved parking ( could not get to my car anymore )
reviews.title: General information lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - power loss on 220 volt for an hour plus
reviews.title: Good location and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We eventually found the Mercure, but the directions were very poor. Dropped the bags and went to park the car in the protected part of the Parking Bourse, a convoluted trip inside the underground parking. (Note -- when we emerged from the parking area, the elevator dropped us in a shopping mall right next to the hotel. Being hungry, we bought two smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches on a triangular-shaped roll with poppy seeds on its top. Delicious! When we left the next day, we left our bags at the desk and picked up two more sandwiches on our way to retrieve the car and then our bags.)
reviews.title: A good place to stay, once we found it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fine. We had requested a room with a view and were given one on the 10th floor with a beautiful view over the city. The room was well-appointed and we had no problems at all.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great weekend stayed there during the music fest on mid June. It's centrally located, within 10 minutes walk to Vieux Port and around 15 minutes walk to St. Charles TGV. Room size is good for 2 persons, bathroom is tidy and the rainforest shower is a surprise for me. BBC is the only English TV channel but fair enough. Buffet breakfast offered various choice of food. Staff are professional and could speak fluent English. We enjoyed a great weekend in the hotel as well as the city of Marseille!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: It was difficult to find the hotel by car initially because it is in a small street in a very busy area. Then the carpark entrance is in another street, so research it carefully beforehand.
reviews.title: Good hotel on very good location

reviews.text: Having done that, it is in a great location beside a big shopping centre and very close to the old port and restaurants. The staff could speak excellent English. For some reason the restaurant wasn't open for dinner but they still hastily provided tables and meals around the bar area. This made it all very casual and friendly and the food was very nice. Breakfast selection was wonderful.
reviews.title: good service at good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mercure Marseille Centre for one night after a Star Clipper cruise. We are familiar with Accor Hotels, having stayed at many Novotels and Sofitels over the years. This Mercure was a good choice due to it's location near the old port, recent refurbishment and reasonable price.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, A Few Things Missing

reviews.text: The outside of the hotel is misleadingly ugly but inside, the refurbishment is very evident. The lobby is clean and modern. The lifts appear new as well. The room is the same. It is evident that a lot of thought went into the amenities and latest technology used. The room card is required to activate the lifts from the lobby. The lifts and the room doors only require a scan, not a swipe of the card (no fumbling with the card to find the correct direction). The room is bright and modern, I really liked the mural of Marseille on the wall, the easy-to-use safe, the instant coffee/tea pot, free WiFi and the ultra-modern bathroom with a rain forest shower head integrated into the ceiling (sorry previous reviewer commenting on showers for short people, I believe you couldn't figure out how to use it correctly).
reviews.title: Mercure - Port and City centric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my opinion there were 3 things missing from an otherwise excellent hotel. 1) The thermostat in the room didn't seem to have any control of the temperature in the room. 2) The room contained only 3 small pillows. We are two people who each use 2 pillows for sinus issues when we sleep. I encountered a bunch of resistance and attitude when requesting another pillow. Shame on the staff member for not just delivering a simple, not uncommon request with a smile. 3) There is no common-use computer for printing airline boarding passes. It took me 3 tries to get a reception person to do the check-in for me from his computer. I don't want to be an ugly American labeling the staff, but two instances in one day leave me a bit disappointed with the service in general.
reviews.title: Shower for short people

reviews.text: The hotel is just few hundred meters from the port/harbor. You can find lots of restaurants nearby if you want to go out for dinner. The service is very good and rooms as supposed are of good quality.
reviews.title: All about location

reviews.text: This is a very comfortable hotel situated about 5 minutes' walk from the old port. It's also next door to a very good shopping centre that has a Galleries Lafayette including an excellent grocery department. Members of staff were very pleasant and helpful. The beer was very expensive. The room was very spacious and comfortable with a very large bed. The shower, however, had to be used by hand as the wall fitting for the spray head was at waist height.
reviews.title: nothing negative

reviews.text: The hotel is of high quality with an excellent situation about 5 minutes to walk from the old Harbour. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Breakfast has a large choice. The hotel was very busy but the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank specially Mr. Franck Balthazard the room division manager who treated my special request in a very Professional manner.
reviews.title: Excellent location - and a great breakfast!

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the city centre - it adjoins the sizeable new shopping centre which has exits to La Canabiere and the Vieux Port so it couldn't be much better. (It's about 10 minutes walk in the other direction to the railway station.) We returned late both nights - from Rue Paradis and Le Panier districts - and felt completely safe at all times.
reviews.title: Recently renovated

reviews.text: We were on the 11th floor and had a great view directly towards Notre Dame de la Garde and with the Vieux Port to the right. There was plenty of space in a good quality room (standard double), and the breakfast was excellent. There were abundant choices for everything, supplemented by a chef who quickly cooked your omelettes,etc. to order.
reviews.title: Not good enough for a 4 start hotel!

reviews.text: The staff at reception were friendly, enthusiastic and helpful - happy to give advice on places to see and things to do. We felt that the lady serving the bar late at night was the only person who had a bad attitude to her job, but it didn't spoil our overall experience.
reviews.title: Not what we expect from a 4-star hotel

description: The Hotel Mercure Marseille Centre has 199 rooms and is located next to the WTC convention center, just a short walk from the Jardin des Vestiges and 5 mins walk from the Vieux Port (old port). The hotel is 5 mins from St Charles TGV train station and 25 mins from the airport by highway. It has a bar and 11 meeting rooms. The hotel is part of the Bourse shopping center, which has over 100 shops. Paying car park.
